2024 年 3 月 19 日星期二 12:04:08 +0000每日 TED 演讲（标清视频） https://www.ted.com/talks TED - TED.com TED 是一个致力于传播值得传播的想法的非营利组织。在此视频中，您将看到 TED 演讲，这些演讲激发、激发和激发了一些世界领先的思想家和实干家的想象力，他们在 TED 会议、TEDx 活动和世界各地的合作伙伴活动的舞台上发表演讲。该播客还提供高清视频和纯音频格式。 TED 会议上值得传播的想法泰德TED 是一个致力于传播值得传播的想法的非营利组织。在此视频中，您将看到 TED 演讲，这些演讲激发、激发和激发了一些世界领先的思想家和实干家的想象力，他们在 TED 会议、TEDx 活动和世界各地的合作伙伴活动的舞台上发表演讲。该播客还提供高清视频和纯音频格式。 zh知识共享：https://creativecommons.org/licenses/by-nc-nd/4.0/泰德contact@ted.com https://pl.tedcdn.com/rss_feed_images/ted_talks_main_podcast/video.png每日 TED 演讲（标清视频） https://www.ted.com/talks 144 144 科学技术娱乐设计 TED、TEDTalks、TED 演讲、灵感、创造力、技术演示、教育不非成人的
亲爱的难民同胞们，这就是我如何找到韧性的|尚塔莱祖兹领袖尚塔莱祖兹领袖Chantale Zuzi Leader is one of the millions of displaced people around the world. In a deeply moving talk, she reflects on losing her family, home and sense of safety — only to break through and ultimately find community and hope. It's an astounding story of resilience that speaks to today's refugee crisis.亲爱的难民同胞们，这就是我如何找到韧性的|尚塔莱祖兹领袖Chantale Zuzi Leader is one of the millions of displaced people around the world. In a deeply moving talk, she reflects on losing her family, home and sense of safety — only to break through and ultimately find community and hope. It's an astounding story of resilience that speaks to today's refugee crisis. https://www.ted.com/talks/chantale_zuzi_leader_dear_fellow_refugees_here_s_how_i_found_resilience?rss en.video.talk.ted.com:126763 126763 Mon, 18 Mar 2024 14:41:43 +0000高等教育不00:11:32泰德
器官捐献的奇迹——未来的突破|阿巴斯·阿德哈里阿巴斯·阿德哈里Organ transplants save lives, but they come with challenges: every minute a healthy donated organ is on ice increases risk. And even if things go perfectly, rejection of the organ is still possible. Cardiothoracic surgeon Abbas Ardehali introduces cutting-edge medical advances in machine perfusion — a portable platform that keeps organs alive outside of the body — that could help put time back on the patient's side.器官捐献的奇迹——未来的突破|阿巴斯·阿德哈里Organ transplants save lives, but they come with challenges: every minute a healthy donated organ is on ice increases risk. And even if things go perfectly, rejection of the organ is still possible. Cardiothoracic surgeon Abbas Ardehali introduces cutting-edge medical advances in machine perfusion — a portable platform that keeps organs alive outside of the body — that could help put time back on the patient's side. https://www.ted.com/talks/abbas_ardehali_the_miracle_of_organ_donation_and_a_breakthrough_for_the_future?rss en.video.talk.ted.com:125536 125536 Fri, 15 Mar 2024 14:36:02 +0000高等教育不00:10:07泰德
了解迷你电网——为数百万人带来电力的清洁能源解决方案通博班达通博班达Hundreds of millions of people lack access to electricity in Sub-Saharan Africa, relying on highly polluting diesel and firewood for power and light. Working to brighten the future in her home country of Malawi and beyond, energy access innovator Tombo Banda makes the case for mini-grids — localized energy systems powered by solar energy that are quick and cheap to deploy — and shares ideas for making them more profitable and scalable.了解迷你电网——为数百万人带来电力的清洁能源解决方案通博班达Hundreds of millions of people lack access to electricity in Sub-Saharan Africa, relying on highly polluting diesel and firewood for power and light. Working to brighten the future in her home country of Malawi and beyond, energy access innovator Tombo Banda makes the case for mini-grids — localized energy systems powered by solar energy that are quick and cheap to deploy — and shares ideas for making them more profitable and scalable. https://www.ted.com/talks/tombo_banda_meet_mini_grids_the_clean_energy_solution_bringing_power_to_millions?rss en.video.talk.ted.com:126754 126754 Thu, 14 Mar 2024 14:50:19 +0000高等教育不00:10:22泰德
自我表达的庇护所如何改变生活 |里德·J·威廉姆斯和林赛·莫里斯里德·J·威廉姆斯和林赛·莫里斯After bringing her son to a summer camp for gender-nonconforming children, photographer Lindsay Morris launched a project to share the campers' stories with the world. One of them, Reed J. Williams, is now a powerful advocate for transgender youth. Together, Morris and Williams reveal two sides to the LGBTQ+ experience — one as a mother, one as a trans woman — and offer insight into the power of community.自我表达的庇护所如何改变生活 |里德·J·威廉姆斯和林赛·莫里斯After bringing her son to a summer camp for gender-nonconforming children, photographer Lindsay Morris launched a project to share the campers' stories with the world. One of them, Reed J. Williams, is now a powerful advocate for transgender youth. Together, Morris and Williams reveal two sides to the LGBTQ+ experience — one as a mother, one as a trans woman — and offer insight into the power of community. https://www.ted.com/talks/reed_j_williams_and_lindsay_morris_how_a_sanctuary_for_self_expression_can_change_lives?rss en.video.talk.ted.com:125620 125620 Wed, 13 Mar 2024 14:58:26 +0000高等教育不00:15:31泰德
农民工的社会安全之路|阿西夫·谢赫阿西夫·谢赫Hundreds of millions of migrant workers travel within their countries to seek out means of survival — often leaving behind all they know for months or even years. Many face poverty and exploitation, and they need a robust social safety net to protect them, says migrant advocate and 2023 Audacious Project grantee Ashif Shaikh. He shares how his grassroots organization Migrants Resilience Collaborative is making life-changing benefits like social security and health care accessible to those who need them while also amplifying migrant voices — paving the way towards a world that supports the workers actually building it. (This ambitious idea is a part of the Audacious Project, TED's initiative to inspire and fund global change.)农民工的社会安全之路|阿西夫·谢赫Hundreds of millions of migrant workers travel within their countries to seek out means of survival — often leaving behind all they know for months or even years. Many face poverty and exploitation, and they need a robust social safety net to protect them, says migrant advocate and 2023 Audacious Project grantee Ashif Shaikh. He shares how his grassroots organization Migrants Resilience Collaborative is making life-changing benefits like social security and health care accessible to those who need them while also amplifying migrant voices — paving the way towards a world that supports the workers actually building it. (This ambitious idea is a part of the Audacious Project, TED's initiative to inspire and fund global change.) https://www.ted.com/talks/ashif_shaikh_a_path_to_social_safety_for_migrant_workers?rss en.video.talk.ted.com:115479 115479 Tue, 12 Mar 2024 14:45:40 +0000高等教育不00:07:57泰德
宇宙的 3 个奥秘——以及可能解释它们的新力量 |亚历克斯·克沙瓦尔兹亚历克斯·克沙瓦尔兹We're still in the dark about what 95 percent of our universe is made of — and the standard model for understanding particle physics has hit a limit. What's the next step forward? Particle physicist Alex Keshavarzi digs into the first results of the Muon g-2 experiment at Fermilab in Chicago, which found compelling evidence of new particles or forces existing in our universe — a finding that could act as a window into the subatomic world and deepen our understanding of the fabric of reality.宇宙的 3 个奥秘——以及可能解释它们的新力量 |亚历克斯·克沙瓦尔兹We're still in the dark about what 95 percent of our universe is made of — and the standard model for understanding particle physics has hit a limit. What's the next step forward? Particle physicist Alex Keshavarzi digs into the first results of the Muon g-2 experiment at Fermilab in Chicago, which found compelling evidence of new particles or forces existing in our universe — a finding that could act as a window into the subatomic world and deepen our understanding of the fabric of reality. https://www.ted.com/talks/alex_keshavarzi_3_mysteries_of_the_universe_and_a_new_force_that_might_explain_them?rss en.video.talk.ted.com:126569 126569 Mon, 11 Mar 2024 14:33:44 +0000高等教育不00:13:25泰德
为什么女性仍然不如男性受到重视？ |玛丽·安·西格特玛丽·安·西格特Women are routinely underestimated, overlooked, interrupted, talked over or mistaken for someone more junior at the workplace. Author Mary Ann Sieghart calls this the "authority gap" — all the ways women are (still) taken less seriously than men, despite proven competence and expertise. She explains how we can close this pernicious gap and why everyone wins when we do so.为什么女性仍然不如男性受到重视？ |玛丽·安·西格特Women are routinely underestimated, overlooked, interrupted, talked over or mistaken for someone more junior at the workplace. Author Mary Ann Sieghart calls this the "authority gap" — all the ways women are (still) taken less seriously than men, despite proven competence and expertise. She explains how we can close this pernicious gap and why everyone wins when we do so. https://www.ted.com/talks/mary_ann_sieghart_why_are_women_still_taken_less_seriously_than_men?rss en.video.talk.ted.com:121643 121643 Fri, 08 Mar 2024 15:46:18 +0000高等教育不00:12:46泰德
对抗营养不良的无名英雄 |什鲁蒂·巴斯卡兰-马坎朱什鲁蒂·巴斯卡兰-马坎朱The pastoralists in Africa sustainably produce meat and milk to help feed the continent. But their way of life — and work — is under threat. Food systems advocate Shruthi Baskaran-Makanju explains how best to preserve these vital communities and why they're key to solving the nutritional challenges of Africa's children.对抗营养不良的无名英雄 |什鲁蒂·巴斯卡兰-马坎朱The pastoralists in Africa sustainably produce meat and milk to help feed the continent. But their way of life — and work — is under threat. Food systems advocate Shruthi Baskaran-Makanju explains how best to preserve these vital communities and why they're key to solving the nutritional challenges of Africa's children. https://www.ted.com/talks/shruthi_baskaran_makanju_the_unsung_heroes_fighting_malnutrition?rss en.video.talk.ted.com:126390 126390 Thu, 07 Mar 2024 15:48:06 +0000高等教育不00:12:18泰德
如何以彻底的坦诚来领导|金·斯科特金·斯科特"How can you say what you mean without being mean?" asks CEO coach and author Kim Scott. Delving into the delicate balance between caring and challenging when leading in the workplace, she introduces "radical candor" as the way to give constructive criticism, compassionately.如何以彻底的坦诚来领导|金·斯科特"How can you say what you mean without being mean?" asks CEO coach and author Kim Scott. Delving into the delicate balance between caring and challenging when leading in the workplace, she introduces "radical candor" as the way to give constructive criticism, compassionately. https://www.ted.com/talks/kim_scott_how_to_lead_with_radical_candor?rss en.video.talk.ted.com:125966 125966 Wed, 06 Mar 2024 16:06:08 +0000高等教育不00:15:19泰德
如何在逆境中找到创造力和目标|苏莱卡·贾瓦德苏莱卡·贾瓦德How can you find strength during life's most difficult moments? Author Suleika Jaouad's experience detailed in the documentary "American Symphony," an intimate portrait of her life as she grapples with illness, is a testament to finding a pathway to healing through artistic expression. In this sweeping conversation with TED's Susan Zimmerman, Jaouad reveals how following curiosity can lead to inspiration — even when it feels like there is none to be found. (Visit ted.com/membership to join TED today and access more exclusive events like this one.)如何在逆境中找到创造力和目标|苏莱卡·贾瓦德How can you find strength during life's most difficult moments? Author Suleika Jaouad's experience detailed in the documentary "American Symphony," an intimate portrait of her life as she grapples with illness, is a testament to finding a pathway to healing through artistic expression. In this sweeping conversation with TED's Susan Zimmerman, Jaouad reveals how following curiosity can lead to inspiration — even when it feels like there is none to be found. (Visit ted.com/membership to join TED today and access more exclusive events like this one.) https://www.ted.com/talks/suleika_jaouad_how_to_find_creativity_and_ Purpose_in_the_face_of_adversity?rss en.video.talk.ted.com:126698 126698 Wed, 06 Mar 2024 15:54:34 +0000高等教育不00:39:09泰德
如何弥合政治分歧——来自对立双方的两个朋友|萨马尔·阿里和克林特·布鲁尔萨马尔·阿里和克林特·布鲁尔On paper, law professor Samar Ali and public affairs strategist Clint Brewer seem to come from very different — and perhaps opposing — backgrounds. But their friendship shows why political polarization in the US isn't as intractable as we might think. In an enlightening conversation, they talk about how to address deepening divides in the US and around the globe — and show the value in discarding the "scare script" by which we demonize others. (This conversation is hosted by TED curator Cloe Shasha Brooks.)如何弥合政治分歧——来自对立双方的两个朋友|萨马尔·阿里和克林特·布鲁尔On paper, law professor Samar Ali and public affairs strategist Clint Brewer seem to come from very different — and perhaps opposing — backgrounds. But their friendship shows why political polarization in the US isn't as intractable as we might think. In an enlightening conversation, they talk about how to address deepening divides in the US and around the globe — and show the value in discarding the "scare script" by which we demonize others. (This conversation is hosted by TED curator Cloe Shasha Brooks.) https://www.ted.com/talks/samar_ali_and_clint_brewer_how_to_bridge_political_divides_from_two_friends_on_oppositing_sides?rss en.video.talk.ted.com:126570 126570 Tue, 05 Mar 2024 15:53:31 +0000高等教育不00:16:55泰德
